info.name: Workwize Public API Documentation
info.description: # Base URLs Production - `https://prod-back.goworkwize.com/api/public` # Authentication API Authentication is done using a Bearer token ## **Getting started guide** ## Get a token To get a token: 1. Log in to an employer/employer admin account. 2. Click on user name on the bottom left corner of the screen to reveal the dropdown menu. 3. Click on _Settings_. 4. Click on _Account_ tab. 5. Scroll down to _API Token_ section. 6. Enter desired name for token. 7. Click on _Generate_ button. ``` ðŸ’¡ Important note: Once the COPY button disappeared, you can never copy the token, ever again. Youâ€™ll have to create a new one. Copy your token immediately and put it in a safe and secure place. ``` 8\. Once generated, click on _COPY_ button. 9\. Use token as Bearer token

request.description:
Get all orders related to the employer.

Also included in the response are the shipments and their statuses.

Shipment status and some explanation:

| status | description |
| --- | --- |
| Delivery appointment scheduled | A delivery appointment is scheduled |
| In Transit | Shipment on the way |
| Delivered | Shipment delivered successfully |
| Returning to sender | The package is on its way back to the sender |
| Failed Attempt | The delivery of the package failed due to some reason. Courier usually leaves a notice and will try to deliver again |
| Available for pickup | The package arrived at a pickup point near you and is available for pickup |
| Picked up by customer | Package picked up by the customer |
| Expired | No tracking information of the shipment, from the last 30 days |
| Pending | No information available on the carrier website or the tracking number is yet to be tracked |
| Preparing Shipment | Package is being prepared to leave warehouse/supplier |
| Order Received | Order is received by the Workwize |
| Order Being Processed | Order is being processed by Workwize. This includes Workwize communicating with courier/s, warehouse/s or supplier/s |
| Being stocked at warehouse | Package is delivered by courier to the warehouse and warehouse is currently processing the package. This process may include identifying the package like model year and serial number. Condition assessment also take place in this stage. |
| Cancelled | Order/offboard is cancelled |
| Out for Delivery | The package is out for delivery |

request.description:
This API allows **employees** or **employers** to create an order for products and assets. The order may include **physical products**, **software assets**, or **both**.

#### **Fields Explanation:**

- **`products`** (optional, array)
    
    - An array of products being ordered.
        
    - Each product object must contain an `id` and `quantity`.
        
    - If empty, at least one asset must be included.
        
- **`assets`** (optional, array)
    
    - An array of software licenses or digital items being ordered.
        
    - If empty, at least one product must be included.
        
- **`tax_identification_number`** (optional, string)
    
    - If provided, updates the employee's tax identification number.
        
- **`delivery_with_express`** (optional, boolean)
    
    - If `true`, validates whether express delivery is possible for the requested items.
        
- **`address_id`** (optional, integer)
    
    - The delivery address for the order.
        
    - If not provided, the employeeâ€™s active address is used.
        
- **`repair_id`** (optional, integer)
    
    - If this order is related to a repair service, the corresponding repair ID is included.

request.description:
This API allows employers to create orders for products from a warehouse. Orders can either be **placed directly** or **submitted as a quote request**.

#### **Fields Explanation:**

- **`products`** (required, array)
    
    - An array of products being ordered, where each product contains an `id` and `quantity`.
        
    - If the array is empty, a `422` error is returned.
        
    - Products are validated for availability before order processing.
        
- **`request_quote`** (optional, boolean)
    
    - Determines whether the order should be a **quote request** instead of a standard order.
        
    - If `true`, the order will be marked as "QUOTE_REQUEST" and processed accordingly.

request.description:
This API allows you to create an order for products and assets in an office. Orders can be placed by an employer, and optionally, an order can be assigned to an employee. Express delivery is available under specific conditions.

#### **Fields Explanation:**

- **`products`** (nullable, array)
    
    - An optional array of products being ordered, where each product contains an `id` and `quantity`.
        
    - If omitted, an empty array will be used.
        
    - Products are validated for stock availability and warehouse restrictions before order processing.
        
- **`assets`** (nullable, array)
    
    - An optional array of assets being ordered, where each asset includes an `id` and `budget_deduction`.
        
    - If omitted, an empty array will be used.
        
    - Assets are validated for stock availability before order processing.
        
- **`assigned_to`** (nullable, integer)
    
    - An optional field that assigns the order to a specific employee.
        
    - If omitted, the order will not be assigned to any employee.
        
- **`delivery_with_express`** (nullable, boolean)
    
    - A boolean flag indicating whether express delivery is requested.
        
    - Default is `false` if not provided.
        
    - If set to `true`, express delivery will be validated based on product and asset types.
        

#### **Express Delivery Restrictions:**

Express delivery is **only** available for items from the warehouse and is **not** applicable to the following categories:

- Stools & Seating Balls
    
- Desks & Office Furniture
    
- Office Chairs
    
- Adjustable Desks
    
- Non-adjustable Desks
    

If any ordered items fall under these categories, express delivery cannot be applied.

request.description:
This API allows an **employer** to create a new employee user. Depending on the route used, the request may require additional details such as role assignment and address information.

---

### **Fields Explanation**

#### **Basic Employee Information**

- **`given_name`** _(required, string)_ â€“ The first name of the employee.
    
- **`family_name`** **/** **`last_name`** _(required, string)_ â€“ The last name of the employee.
    
- **`email`** _(required, string)_ â€“ The employeeâ€™s work email address.
    
- **`phone_number`** _(required, string)_ â€“ The employeeâ€™s phone number.
    
- **`personal_email`** _(optional, string, email format)_ â€“ The employeeâ€™s personal email.
    
- **`personal_phone_number`** _(optional, string)_ â€“ The employeeâ€™s personal phone number.
    
- **`role`** _(required, string)_ â€“ The department or role the employee belongs to.
    
- **`is_notified`** _(optional, boolean)_ â€“ Determines if the employee should receive a notification upon creation.
    
- **`foreign_id`** _(optional, string)_ â€“ External system reference ID for this employee.
    

#### **Address Information**

- **`address`** _(optional, object)_ â€“ An object containing the employeeâ€™s address details.
    
    - **`address_line_1`** _(required_unless:address,null, string)_ â€“ Primary address line.
        
    - **`address_line_2`** _(optional, string)_ â€“ Secondary address line.
        
    - **`additional_address_line`** \*(optional, string)\* â€“ Additional address details.
        
- **`city`** _(required_unless:address,null, string)_ â€“ City name.
    
- **`region`** _(required_unless:address,null, string)_ â€“ State/Province/Region.
    
- **`postal_code`** _(required_unless:address,null, string)_ â€“ ZIP/Postal code.
    
- **`country_code_iso2`** _(required_unless:address,null, string)_ â€“ Two-letter country code (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2).

item.name: Create An Asset For An Employee

request.description:
This API allows an **employer** to create an **asset** for an employee. Assets can be either **purchased** or **rented**, and each asset is associated with a category, budget deduction, and other financial details.

### **Fields Explanation**

#### **Asset Information**

- **`name`** _(required, string)_ â€“ The name of the asset.
    
- **`type`** _(required, string, enum:_ `Buy`_,_ `Rent`_)_ â€“ Defines whether the asset is purchased or rented.
    
- **`category_id`** _(required, integer, exists:categories,id)_ â€“ The ID of the asset category.
    
- **`depreciation_months`** _(conditional, integer)_ â€“
    
    - Required if `type` is **Buy** (`>= 1 month`).
        
    - Must not be included if `type` is **Rent**.
        
- **`budget_deduction`** _(required, numeric)_ â€“ The amount deducted from the budget for this asset.
    
- **`invoice_price`** _(optional, numeric)_ â€“ The price listed on the invoice.
    
- **`date_ordered`** _(required, date format:_ `YYYY-MM-DD`_)_ â€“ The date when the asset was ordered.
    
- **`currency`** _(required, string, ISO 4217 format)_ â€“ one of EUR, USD, GBP, CAD, AUD, CHF, INR, ZAR, ILS, SGD, AED, CNY, KRW, JPY, UAH, EGP, NGN, RSD, ISK, TRY, SAR, IDR, MYR, VND, PKR, HKD or NZD
    
- **`rent_end_date`** _(optional, date, required if_ `type` _is Rent)_ â€“ The date when the rental period ends.
    
- **`note`** _(optional, string)_ â€“ Additional comments or notes about the asset.
    
- **`tags`** _(optional, array of integers)_ â€“ A list of tag IDs associated with the asset.
    
- **`serial_code`** _(optional, string)_ â€“ The serial number of the asset.
    
- **`image`** _(optional, array)_ â€“ Array of the URLs for the images
    
- **`warehouse_status`** _(optional, enum:_ `Available`_,_ `Reserved`_,_ `Sold`_, etc.)_ â€“ The current status of the asset in inventory.

request.description:
This API allows **employers** to add a new **address** for an **employee**. The added address is stored as the employeeâ€™s **shipping address** and can be updated later.

#### **Request Parameters:**

- **Address Information**
    
    - `address_line_1` (optional, string) â€“ The first line of the street address.
        
    - `address_line_2` (optional, string) â€“ The second line of the street address (e.g., apartment, suite number).
        
    - `additional_address_line` (optional, string) - Any additional address line that you would like to add
        
    - `city` (required, string) â€“ The city of the address.
        
    - `postal_code` (required, string) â€“ The postal code or zip code of the address.
        
    - `country_id` (required, integer) â€“ The ID of the country for the address. This field is used for creating the main address.
        
    - `region` (optional, string) - The region of the address. This field is derived from `country_id` and used for shipping addresses.
        
    - `phone_number` (optional, string) â€“ The phone number associated with the address. If not provided, and the `addressOwner` has a user associated, the user's phone number will be used.

request.description:
Update an employeeâ€™s address.

Note that a field with `null` or `""` value will be updated to that value.

Example: payload of `{"region": ""}` will result to `{"region": ""}` in response.

To ignore a field, the field must be removed from the payload.

For example we haveðŸ‘‡ as base data

``` json
{
    "region": "test region",
    "city": "test city"
}

 ```

To ignore the region, the payload must be

``` json
{
    "city": "another city"
}

 ```

And will result to

``` json
{
    "region": "test region",
    "city": "another city"
}

 ```

#### **Request Parameters:**

- **Address Information**
    
    - `address_line_1` (optional, string) â€“ The first line of the street address.
        
    - `address_line_2` (optional, string) â€“ The second line of the street address (e.g., apartment, suite number).
        
    - `additional_address_line` (optional, string) - Any additional address line that you would like to add
        
    - `city` (optional, string) â€“ The city of the address.
        
    - `postal_code` (optional, string) â€“ The postal code or zip code of the address.
        
    - `country_id` (optional, integer) â€“ The ID of the country for the address. This field is used for creating the main address.
        
    - `region` (optional, string) - The region of the address. This field is derived from `country_id` and used for shipping addresses.
        
    - `phone_number` (optional, string) â€“ The phone number associated with the address. If not provided, and the `addressOwner` has a user associated, the user's phone number will be used.

Filters offboarding requests by status. Multiple statuses can be provided, separated by commas. Example: in_transit_to_warehouse
A search term to filter offboarding requests. For example you can search by employee first name, last name, company name or ID. Example: John

request.description:
This API endpoint creates a new offboarding request.

**Request Parameters:**

- `employee_id` (required, integer): The ID of the employee being offboarded.
    
- `assets` (required, array, min:1): An array of asset IDs to be included in the offboarding.
    
- `destination_type` (required, string, in:warehouse,office): The type of destination for the offboarded assets. Must be either "warehouse" or "office".
    
- `destination_code` (required, string): The code of the destination (either a warehouse or an office). It can be either office ID or warehouse code

response.name: Create Offboard
